I would recommend "The Rum Diary" based on your preference cues and the information provided in your request.

"The Rum Diary" is a novel by David Fincher that was published in 2014. The story revolves around Paul Kemp, a fast climbing constable who leads a disobedient group of young men engaging in juvenile delinquency and violence that was left behind by their guardian chief. Paul Kemp as a new leader makes different encounters to find money for survival where he got arrested. His set free with the help an uptown girl julian whom they later develop affection. As time passes, he decides to drop the drug business aside for good and focus living a positive life as boxer. In the path of success to his dream as an international boxing champion, things worsen when his former boss face blackmails him by abducting ghetto brother buggie with interest of using him transport drugs outside the country. He beats odds offering his african title match prize to liberate the brother and later transformed his ghetto family
